column4: as a launcher: right click panel, add to panel, custom app launcher and you'll know what to enter
right click 'Applications', edit menu, add entry with right command and icon of your choice
thanks but when I start the application i get a message it can't find application's directory
what command did you enter in the box? and what command is that? Try it in a terminal first
stata-se it's a commercial application for linux which installed in $HOME/stata
you used the full path, like /home/joey/stata/stata-se ?
what with "cd /home/joey/stata && stata-se" ? is the executable itself not found or does it complain about other stuffnog found?
yes
I don't know; if the shell works, write a little script and execute that in the launcher, like #!/bin/bash and 2nd line /home/joey/stata/stata-se
nope
cannot find Stata directory
then I don't know, does it work if you click it in the file manager? Then create a symlink to it on your desktop and drag that onto the panel, maybe works. Else I give up
it's just fscked up, that's all
may be I will all /home/joey/stata to $PATH ?
that will only help to execute stata-se directly without path, but give it a shot; you know how to do that?
what else can I try?
yes, that's why I suggested cd blah && execute, to set current directory first; but add it to $PATH, won't hurt
where did you suggest that?
put it on ubuntuforums in general help and go to bed before you get frustrated, try again tomorrow
I can understand why people are complaining about Desktop usability. Something as simple as running application from the panel and there are so many problems
